conclusion: Acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
In a v-t graph, the slope of the velocity curve represents acceleration.
For object B, the v-t graph shows a curve that starts at zero, increases to a maximum, and then decreases back to zero at t2.
The slope of the curve is positive initially, indicating a positive acceleration as the velocity increases.
As the curve reaches its peak and starts to descend, the slope becomes negative, indicating a negative acceleration as the velocity decreases.
The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is initially positive, reaches zero at the peak velocity, and then becomes negative.
